   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   50:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   51:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   52:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   53:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   54:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     zip_groups().
   58: 
   59: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   60: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   61: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   62: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   63: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   64: 
   65: zip_groups() ->
   66: 
   67:     ZipGroup=
   68:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   69:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   70:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   71:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   72: 
   73:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   74:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   75:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   80: 
   81: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   82:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   83: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   84:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   85: 
   86: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   87:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   88:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   89:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   90:         [_Mode] ->
   91:             Z64Mode
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: zip_testcases() ->
   95:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   96: 
   97: zip64_testcases() ->
   98:     [unzip64_central_headers,
   99:      zip64_central_directory].
  100: 
  101: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  103:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  104:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  105:           {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  106:           _ -> ok
  107:       end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(get_value(priv_dir,Config), "*"))],
  108:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  109: 
  110: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  111:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  115:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  116: 
  117:     case {disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  118:         {error, _} ->
  119:                 {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  120:                  "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  121:         {N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= 6 * (1 bsl 30) ->
  122:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  123:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  124:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  125:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  126:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  127:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  128: 
  129:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  130:         {N,M} when N < 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  131:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  132:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w Byte~n", [M]),
  133:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free"}
  134:     end;
  135: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  136:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  137:         true ->
  138:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  139:                 undefined ->
  140:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  141:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  142:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  143:                 _Zip ->
  144:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  145:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  146:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  147:             end;
  148:         false ->
  149:             Config
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  153:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  154:     Config.
  155: 
  156: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  157:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  158:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  159:     UsesEMZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= emzip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unemzip,
  160:     Memsize = memsize(),
  161:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  162:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  163:        UsesEMZip andalso Memsize < 8 bsl 30 ->
  164:             {skip, "Testing emzip needs more that 8 GB of memory"};
  165:        true ->
  166:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  167:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  168:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  169:     end.
  170: 
  171: 
  172: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  173:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  174:     Config.
  175: 
  176: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  177: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  178: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  179: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  181:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  182: 
  183:     Record = 512,
  184:     Block = 20 * Record,
  185: 
  186:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  187:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  188:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  189:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  190:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  191: 
  192:     %% Clean up.
  193:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  194:     ok.
  195: 
  196: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  197:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  198:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  199:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  200: 
  201:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  202:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  203:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  204:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  205:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  206: 
  207:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  208:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  209:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  210:                     info = Info,
  211:                     offset = 0,
  212:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  213:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  214:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  215: 
  216:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  217:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  218:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  219: 
  220: 
  221:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  222:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  223: 
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  227:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  228:         true ->
  229:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  230:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  231:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  232:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  233:         _ ->
  234:             ok
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  238:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  239: 
  240: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  241:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  242:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  243: 
  244: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  245:     receive
  246:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  247:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  248:         {Port, eof} ->
  249:             Port ! {self(), close},
  250:             receive
  251:                 {Port, closed} ->
  252:                     true
  253:             end,
  254:             receive
  255:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  256:                     ok
  257:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  258:                     ok
  259:             end,
  260:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  261:     end.
  262: 
  263: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  264:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  265: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  266:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  267: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  268:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  269: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  270:     ok.
  271: 
  272: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  273:     unlink(Port),
  274:     exit(Port, die),
  275:     ct:fail(Reason).
  276: 
  277: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  278:     Cmd.
  279: %%     case os:type() of
  280: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  281: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  282: %%     end.
  283: 
  284: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  285: 
  286: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  287:     X = next_random(X0),
  288:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  289:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  290:         _ -> false
  291:     end;
  292: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  293:     true.
  294: 
  295: %% Generates a random byte list.
  296: 
  297: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  298:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  299: 
  300: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  301:     X = next_random(X0),
  302:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  303: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  304:     lists:reverse(Result).
  305: 
  306: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  307: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  308: 
  309: next_random(X) ->
  310:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  311: 
  312: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  313: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  314: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  315:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  316:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  317:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  318:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  319: 
  320:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  321: 
  322:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  323:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  324:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  325: 
  326:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  327: 
  328:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  329:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  330:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  331:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  332: 
  333:     %% Clean up.
  334:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  335: 
  336:     ok.
  337: 
  338: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  339: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  340: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  342:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  343:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  344:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  345: 
  346:     %% Create a zip archive
  347:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  348:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  349: 
  350:     %% Open archive
  351:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  352: 
  353:     %% List dir
  354:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  355: 
  356:     %% Get a file
  357:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  358:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  359:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  360:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  361:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  362: 
  363:     %% Get all files
  364:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  365:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  366:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  367: 
  368:     %% Close
  369:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  370: 
  371:     %% Clean up.
  372:     delete_files([Names]),
  373: 
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  377: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  378: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  379: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  380:     %% Create a zip archive
  381:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  382:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  383: 
  384:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  385:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  386: 
  387:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  388:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  389: 
  390:     %% Clean up.
  391:     delete_files([Zip]),
  392: 
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  396:     Self = self(),
  397:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  398:     receive
  399:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  400:             ZipSrv
  401:     end.
  402: 
  403: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  404:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  405:     receive
  406:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  407:             true
  408:     after 1000 ->
  409:             false
  410:     end.
  411: 
  412: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  413: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  415:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  416:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  417: 
  418:     %% create a temp directory
  419:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  420:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  421: 
  422:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  423: 
  424:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  425:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  426: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  427: 
  428:     %% Verify.
  429:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  430:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  431: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  432: 		  FList),
  433:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  434: 		  RetList),
  435: 
  436:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  437:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  438: 
  439:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  440: 
  441:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  442:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  443: 
  444:     %% Verify.
  445:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  446:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  447: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  448: 		  FList2),
  449:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  450: 		  RetList2),
  451: 
  452:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  453:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  454:     ok.
  455: 
  456: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  457: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  458:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  459:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  460:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  461: 
  462:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  463:     %% clash.txt
  464:     %% ../clash.txt
  465:     %% ../above.txt
  466:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  467: 
  468:     %% create a temp directory
  469:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  470:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  471:     
  472:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  473:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  474:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  475: 
  476:     %% unzip in SubDir
  477:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  478: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  479: 
  480:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  481: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  482:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  483:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  484: 
  485:     %% clean up
  486:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  487:     
  488:      %% create the temp directory again
  489:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  490: 
  491:     %% unzip in SubDir
  492:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  493: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  494: 
  495:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  496: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  497:    
  498:     %% clean up
  499:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  500:     ok.
  501: 
  502: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  503: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  505:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  506:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  507: 
  508:     %% create a temp directory
  509:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  510:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  511: 
  512:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  513: 
  514:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  515: 
  516:     %% Verify.
  517:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  518: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  519: 		  FList),
  520:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  521:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  522:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  523:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  524:                           end
  525:                   end,
  526: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  527: 
  528:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  529:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  530:     ok.
  531: 
  532: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  533: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  535:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  536:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  537:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  538: 
  539:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  540:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  541: 
  542:     %% Create a zip archive
  543:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  544:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  545: 
  546:     %% Open archive
  547:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  548: 
  549:     %% List dir
  550:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  551: 
  552:     %% Get a file
  553:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  554:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  555:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  556: 
  557:     %% Get all files
  558:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  559:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  560:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  561: 
  562:     %% Close
  563:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  564: 
  565:     %% Clean up.
  566:     delete_files([Names]),
  567: 
  568:     ok.
  569: 
  570: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  571: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572: 
  573:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  574:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  575: 
  576:     {ok,
  577:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  578:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  579: 
  580:     {ok,
  581:      [#zip_comment{},
  582:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  583:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  584:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  585:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  586:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  587: 
  588:     ok.
  589: 
  590: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  591: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  592:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  593: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  594:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  595:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  596: 
  597: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  598: char_seq(N, First) ->
  599:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  600: 
  601: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  602:     Result;
  603: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  604:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  605: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  606:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  607: 
  608: data_files() ->
  609:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  610:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  611:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  612:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  613:     create_files(Files),
  614:     Files.
  615: 
  616: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  617:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  618:     create_files(Rest);
  619: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  620:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  621:     create_files(Rest);
  622: create_files([]) ->
  623:     ok.
  624:

  626: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),

  628: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  629: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  630: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  631: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  632: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  633: %%     Dir.
  634: 
  635: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  636: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  637:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  638:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  639:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  640:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  641:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  642:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  643:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  644:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  645:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  646:                   end,
  647:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  648:     ok.
  649: 
  650: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  651:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  652:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  653: 
  654: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  655:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  656: 
  657:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  658:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  659:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  660:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  661:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  662:     case What(Full) of
  663:         Expected ->
  664:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  665:         Other ->
  666:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  667:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  668:     end.
  669: 
  670: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  671: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  672:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  673:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  674:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  675:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  676:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  677: 
  678:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  679:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  680: 
  681:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  682:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  683: 
  684:     %% Verify.
  685:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  686:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  687:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  688:                               true ->
  689:                                   <<>> = B,
  690:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  691:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  692:                               false ->
  693:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  694:                           end
  695:                   end, FBList),
  696: 
  697:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  698:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  699: 
  700:     ok.
  701: 
  702: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  703: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  704:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  705:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  706:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "zip_to_binary"),

  716:     {ok, {ZipName, ZipB}} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName], [memory]),
  717:

  721:     %% Zip to a file

  727:     {ok, [{FileName, FData}]} = zip:unzip(ZipB, [memory]),

  755: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  756: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  757:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  758:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  759:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  760:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  761: 
  762:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  763:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  764:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  765:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  766:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  767:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  768:     EmptyDir = "empty/",
  769:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  770: 
  771:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  772:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  773:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,EmptyDir,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  774: 
  775:     %% Verify.
  776:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  777:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  778:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  779: 
  780:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  781:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  782:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  783: 
  784:     %% Clean up.
  785:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  786: 
  787:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  788:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  789: 
  790:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary with skip_directories
  791:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  792:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  793: 
  794:     %% Verify.
  795:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  796:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  797:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  798: 
  799:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  800:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  801:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  802: 
  803:     %% Clean up.
  804:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  805: 
  806:     ok.

  808: %% oac_files() ->
  809: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  810: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  811: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  812: %%     create_files(Files),
  813: %%     Files.
  814: 
  815: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  816: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  817: delete_files(List) ->
  818:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  819: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  820:     Cnt;
  821: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  822:     case file:delete(Item) of
  823:         ok ->
  824:             DelCnt = 1;
  825:         {error,eperm} ->
  826:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  827:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  828:             file:del_dir(Item);
  829:         {error,eacces} ->
  830:             %% We'll see about that!
  831:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  832:             case file:delete(Item) of
  833:                 ok ->
  834: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  835:                 {error,_} ->
  836:                     erlang:yield(),
  837:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  838:                     file:delete(Item),
  839:                     DelCnt = 1
  840:             end;
  841:         {error,_} ->
  842:             DelCnt = 0
  843:     end,
  844:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  845: 
  846: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  847: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  849:     Dir = "compress_control",
  850:     Files = [
  851:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  852:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  853:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  854:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  855:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  856:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  857:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  858:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  859:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  860:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  861:             ],
  862: 
  863:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  864: 			  Files,
  865: 			  [{compress, []}],
  866: 			  []),
  867: 
  868:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  869: 			  Files,
  870: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  871: 			  []),
  872: 
  873:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  874: 			  Files,
  875: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  876: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  877: 
  878:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  879: 			  Files,
  880: 			  [],
  881: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  882: 
  883:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  884: 			  Files,
  885: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  886: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  887: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  888: 
  889:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  890: 			  Files,
  891: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  892: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  893: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  894: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  895: 
  896:     ok.
  897: 
  898: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  899:     %% Cleanup
  900:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  901:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  902:     delete_files([Zip]),
  903:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  904: 
  905:     create_files(Files),
  906:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  907: 
  908:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  909:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  910:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  911:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  912:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  913: 
  914:     %% Cleanup
  915:     delete_files([Zip]),
  916:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  917: 
  918:     ok.
  919: 
  920: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  921:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  922:         case Kind of
  923:             dir ->
  924:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  925:             _   ->
  926:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  927:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  928:         end,
  929:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  930:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  931: 
  932:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  933:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  934:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  935:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  936:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  937:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  938:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  939:     end,
  940:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  941: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  942:     ok.
  943: 
  944: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  945:     false;
  946: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  947:     CompressOpt =
  948:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  949:             [] -> all;
  950:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  951:         end,
  952:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  953:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  954:     UncompressOpt =
  955:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  956:             [] -> Default;
  957:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  958:         end,
  959:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  960:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  961: 
  962: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  963:     case H of
  964:         all ->
  965:             extensions(T, H);
  966:         H when is_list(H) ->
  967:             extensions(T, H);
  968:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  969:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  970:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  971:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  972:         _ ->
  973:             extensions(T, Old)
  974:     end;
  975: extensions([], Old) ->
  976:     Old.
  977: 
  978: foldl(Config) ->
  979:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  980:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  981: 
  982:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  983:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  984:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  985:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  986:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  987:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  988:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  989:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  990:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  991: 	try
  992: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  993: 	catch
  994: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  995: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  996: 	end,
  997:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  998:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  999: 
 1000:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1001:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1002:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1003: 
 1004:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1005:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1006: 
 1007:     ok.
 1008: 
 1009: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1010:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1011:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1012:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1013:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1014:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1015:                          ok
 1016:                  end,
 1017:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1018: 
 1019:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1020:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1021:                                                  ["none"]),
 1022:                         ok
 1023:                 end,
 1024:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1025: 
 1026:     ok.
 1027: 
 1028: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1029:     ok;
 1030: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1031:     try Bad() of
 1032:         ok ->
 1033:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1034:     catch
 1035:         C:R:Stk ->
 1036:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1037:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1038:     end.
 1039: 
 1040: unicode(Config) ->
 1041:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1042:         latin1 ->
 1043:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1044:         utf8 ->
 1045:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1046:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1047:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1048:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1049:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1050:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1051:             case has_zip() of
 1052:                 false ->
 1053:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1054:                 true ->
 1055:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1056:                         true ->
 1057:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1058:                             ok;
 1059:                         false ->
 1060:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1061:                     end
 1062:             end
 1063:     end.
 1064: 
 1065: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1066:     FancyName = "d",
 1067:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1068: 
 1069:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1070:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1071: 
 1072: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1073:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1074:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1075:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1076:     [begin
 1077:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1078:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1079:      end ||
 1080:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1081:     ok.
 1082: 
 1083: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1084:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1085:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1086:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1087:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1088:     {ok, Archive} =
 1089:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1090:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1091: 
 1092: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1093:     case test_zip1() of
 1094:         false ->
 1095:             ok;
 1096:         true ->
 1097:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1098:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1099:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1100:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1101:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1102:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1103:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1104:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1105:     end.
 1106: 
 1107: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1108:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1109:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1110:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1111:     ok.
 1112: 
 1113: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1114:     case test_zip1() of
 1115:         false ->
 1116:             ok;
 1117:         true ->
 1118:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1119:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1120:             Comment = [Char],
 1121:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1122:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1123: 
 1124:             {ok, _} =
 1125:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1126:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1127:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1128:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1129: 
 1130:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1131:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1132:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1133:     end.
 1134: 
 1135: test_zip1() ->
 1136:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1137: 
 1138: has_zip() ->
 1139:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1140: 
 1141: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1142:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1143:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1144: 
 1145: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1146:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1147:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1148:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1149:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1150:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1151:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1152:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1153:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1154:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1155:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1156:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1157:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1158:     ok.
 1159: 
 1160: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1161:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1162:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1163:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1164:     Comment = [9999999],
 1165:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1166:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1167: 
 1168: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1169:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1170:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1171:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1172:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1173: 
 1174: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1175:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1176:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1177:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1178:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1179:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1180:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1181:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1182:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1183:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1184:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1185:             ok;
 1186:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1187:     end.
 1188: 
 1189: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1190:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1191:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1192:              receive
 1193:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1194:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1195:                               Reciver()
 1196:              end
 1197:      end)().
 1198:     
 1199: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1200:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1201:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1202:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1203:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1204:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1205:     ok.
 1206: 
 1207: mode(Config) ->
 1208: 
 1209:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1210:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1211:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1212: 
 1213:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1214:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1215:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1216:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1217: 
 1218:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1219:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1220:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1221:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1222: 
 1223:     ?assertMatch(
 1224:        {ok, Archive},
 1225:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1226: 
 1227:     ?assertMatch(
 1228:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1229:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}},
 1230:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}} ]},
 1231:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1232: 
 1233:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1234:     ?assertMatch(
 1235:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1236: 
 1237:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1238:         true ->
 1239:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1240:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1241:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, ExecMode band 8#777),
 1242: 
 1243:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1244:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1245:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, DirMode band 8#777);
 1246:         false ->
 1247:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1248:             ok
 1249:     end,
 1250: 
 1251:     ok.
 1252: 
 1253: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1254: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1255: %%  * compressed size
 1256: %%  * uncompressed size
 1257: %%  * relative offset
 1258: %%  * starting disk
 1259: %%
 1260: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1261: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1262: 
 1263:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1264:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1265: 
 1266:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1267:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1268:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1269: 
 1270:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1271:     %% different header combinations.
 1272:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1273:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1274:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1275:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1276:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1277:     %%
 1278:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1279: 
 1280:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1281:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1282:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../medium.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1283:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1284:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1285:     ?assertMatch(
 1286:        {ok, Archive},
 1287:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1288:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1289:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1290:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1291: 
 1292:     %% Check that list archive works
 1293:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1294:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1295:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1296:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1297:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1298:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1299:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1300:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1301:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1302:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1303:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1304:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1305:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1306:          ]} =
 1307:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1308:     ok.
 1309: 
 1310: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1311: 
 1312:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1313:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1314:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1315:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1316:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1317: 
 1318:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1319:     lists:map(
 1320:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1321:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1322:               ?assertMatch(
 1323:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1324:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1325:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1326:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1327:           F(Name) ->
 1328:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1329:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1330:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1331: 
 1332:     ok.
 1333: 
 1334: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1335: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1336: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1337: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1338: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1339: %%
 1340: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1341: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1342: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1343: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1344: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1345: 
 1346:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1347:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1348:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1349: 
 1350:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1351: 
 1352:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1353:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1354:     lists:foreach(
 1355:       fun(I) ->
 1356:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1357:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1358:     ?assertMatch(
 1359:        {ok, Archive},
 1360:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1361: 
 1362:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1363:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1364: 
 1365:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1366:     ?assertMatch(
 1367:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1368:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1369:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1370:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1371:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1372: 
 1373:     ok.
 1374: 
 1375: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1376: %% mtime of the file
 1377: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1378:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1379:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1380:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1381:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1382: 
 1383:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1384:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1385:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1386: 
 1387:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1388:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1389: 
 1390:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1391:     ?assertMatch(
 1392:        {ok, Archive},
 1393:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1394: 
 1395:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1396:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1397:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1398: 
 1399:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1400:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1401:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1402: 
 1403:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1404:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1405:     %% are in precise.
 1406:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1407:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1408: 
 1409:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1410:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1411: 
 1412:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1413:     ?assertMatch(
 1414:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1415:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1416: 
 1417:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1418:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1419:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1420:                              }} =
 1421:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1422: 
 1423: 
 1424:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1425: 
 1426:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1427:         true ->
 1428:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1429:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1430: 
 1431:             ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1432:         false ->
 1433:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1434:             ok
 1435:     end,
 1436: 
 1437:     ok.
 1438: 
 1439: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1440: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1441: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1442: 
 1443:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep USE_EF_UT_TIME") of
 1444:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support extended timestamps"};
 1445:         _ ->
 1446:             PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1447:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1448:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1449:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1450: 
 1451:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1452:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1453:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1454: 
 1455:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1456:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1457: 
 1458:             ?assertMatch(
 1459:                {ok, Archive},
 1460:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1461: 
 1462:             %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1463:             %% the mtime will be correct here
 1464:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1465:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1466:                 zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1467: 
 1468:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1469:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1470:             ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1471: 
 1472:             ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1473: 
 1474:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1475:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1476: 
 1477:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1478:             ?assertMatch(
 1479:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1480:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1481: 
 1482:             {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1483:                                        mtime = UnZMtime,
 1484:                                        ctime = UnZCtime
 1485:                                      }} =
 1486:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1487: 
 1488:             ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1489: 
 1490:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1491:                 true ->
 1492:                     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1493:                     ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1494: 
 1495:                     ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1496:                 false ->
 1497:                     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1498:                     ok
 1499:             end,
 1500: 
 1501:             ok
 1502:     end.
 1503: 
 1504: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1505: 
 1506:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep STORE_UNIX_UIDs_GIDs") of
 1507:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support uid/gids"};
 1508:         _ ->
 1509: 
 1510:             PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1511:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1512:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1513:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1514: 
 1515:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1516:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1517:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1518: 
 1519:             ?assertMatch(
 1520:                {ok, Archive},
 1521:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1522: 
 1523:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1524:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1525:                 zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1526: 
 1527:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1528:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1529: 
 1530:             ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1531:             ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1532: 
 1533:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1534:             ?assertMatch(
 1535:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1536:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1537: 
 1538:             {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1539:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1540: 
 1541:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1542:                 true ->
 1543:                     ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1544:                     ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1545:                 _ ->
 1546:                     %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1547:                     ok
 1548:             end,
 1549: 
 1550:             ok
 1551:     end.
 1552: 
 1553: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1554: %%% Generic zip interface
 1555: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1556: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1557:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1558:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1559: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1560:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1561:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1562:     {ok, Archive};
 1563: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1564:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1565:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1566: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1567:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1568:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1569:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1570:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1571:           fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1572:                   AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1573:                   {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1574:                   {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1575:                       if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1576:                               {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1577:                               lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ Fn => <<>> },
 1578:                                              [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1579:                          Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1580:                               %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1581:                               %% the binary for files that are links to the same file.
 1582:                               %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1583:                               {[],
 1584:                                case file:read_link_all(AbsFn) of
 1585:                                   {ok, LinkFn} ->
 1586:                                       case maps:get(LinkFn, Cache, undefined) of
 1587:                                           undefined ->
 1588:                                               {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1589:                                               Cache#{ LinkFn => Data, Fn => Data };
 1590:                                           Data ->
 1591:                                               Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1592:                                       end;
 1593:                                   {error, _} ->
 1594:                                       {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1595:                                       Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1596:                               end}
 1597:                       end,
 1598:                   {[{Fn, maps:get(Fn, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1599:           end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1600:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1601: 
 1602: 
 1603: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1604:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1605: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1606:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1607:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1608:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1609:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1610:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1611:            lists:flatmap(
 1612:              fun(Ln) ->
 1613:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1614:                          nomatch -> [];
 1615:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1616:                      end
 1617:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1618: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1619:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1620:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1621:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1622: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1623:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1624:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1625:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1626:            [begin
 1627:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1628:                     $/ ->
 1629:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1630:                     _ ->
 1631:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1632:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1633:                 end,
 1634:                 F -- Cwd
 1635:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1636: 
 1637: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1638:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1639:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1640:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1641:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1642: 
 1643:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1644:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1645: 
 1646:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1647:     
 1648:     file:close(Src),
 1649:     file:close(Tgt).
 1650: 
 1651: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1652: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1653:     
 1654:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1655:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1656:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1657:         {E, E} ->
 1658:             ok
 1659:     end;
 1660: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1661:     ok.
 1662: 
 1663: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1664:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1665:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1666:     Res.
 1667: 
 1668: disc_free(Path) ->
 1669:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1670: 
 1671:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1672:     Partitions =
 1673:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1674:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1675: 
 1676:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1677:     %% path first.
 1678:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1679:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1680:         [] -> error
 1681:     end.
 1682: 
 1683: memsize() ->
 1684:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1685:         undefined ->
 1686:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1687:             Tot;
 1688:         Available ->
 1689:             Available
 1690:     end.
